December 19, 1982: Fiction
SPACE, by James A. Michener. (Random House, $17.95.) The story of the
American space program told through fiction.
2010: ODYSSEY TWO, by Arthur C. Clarke. (Ballantine/Del Rey, $14.95.) A
continuation of the tale begun in ''2001: A Space Odyssey.''
MISTRAL'S DAUGHTER, by Judith Krantz. (Crown, $15.95.) The art world of the
20's and the fashion industry of the 80's.
E.T. THE EXTRA-TERRESTRIAL STORYBOOK, by William Kotzwinkle. (Putnam,
$6.95.) Abridged, profusely illustrated version of the novelization of the current
film.
THE VALLEY OF HORSES, by Jean M. Auel. (Crown, $15.95.) A continuation of
the saga of human survival at the dawn of civilization begun in ''The Clan of the
Cave Bear.''
FOUNDATION'S EDGE, by Isaac Asimov. (Doubleday, $14.95.) The struggle to
keep civilization alive in a crumbling empire: science fiction.
MASTER OF THE GAME, by Sidney Sheldon. (Morrow, $15.95.) The hidden truth
behind a woman business tycoon's rise to power.
DIFFERENT SEASONS, by Stephen King. (Viking, $16.95.) Four novellas with
mainly nonhorror themes by a modern master of horror.
CROSSINGS, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $15.95.) A clandestine trans-Atlantic
romance survives the stresses and strains of World War II.
LIFE, THE UNIVERSE AND EVERYTHING, by Douglas Adams. (Harmony,
$9.95.) On a journey through space, two Englishmen find answers to all their
questions about existence: science fiction-fantasy.
DEADEYE DICK, by Kurt Vonnegut. (Delacorte/Seymour Lawrence, $14.95.)
Observations on contemporary life seen through the story of a youthful criminal
who grows up to be a playwright.
LIFE SENTENCES, by Elizabeth Forsythe Hailey. (Delacorte, $14.95.) Old college
chums come to a woman's aid in her time of crisis.
GOODBYE, MICKEY MOUSE, by Len Deighton. (Knopf, $14.95.) World War II
pilots in military and romantic encounters.
THE PARSIFAL MOSAIC, by Robert Ludlum. (Random House, $15.95.) Michael
Havelock saves the world from nuclear extinction.
SECOND HEAVEN, by Judith Guest. (Viking, $14.95.) Two emotionally battered
December 19, 1982
Non-Fiction
AND MORE BY ANDY ROONEY, by Andrew A. Rooney. (Atheneum, $12.95.) A
new collection of essays by the journalist and television commentator.
JANE FONDA'S WORKOUT BOOK, by Jane Fonda. (Simon & Schuster, $18.95.)
An exercise book for women, seasoned with the film star's philosophy of physical
well-being.
LIVING, LOVING & LEARNING, by Leo Buscaglia. (Holt/Slack, $13.50.)
Inspirational talks by a University of Southern California professor.
GROWING UP, by Russell Baker. (Congdon & Weed, $15.) The New York Times
columnist recalls his boyhood and youth.
KEEPING FAITH, by Jimmy Carter. (Bantam, $22.50.) The 39th President recalls
his four years in office.
MEGATRENDS, by John Naisbitt. (Warner, $15.50.) Predictions about America in
the next decade based on an analysis of conditions today.
A LIGHT IN THE ATTIC, by Shel Silverstein. (Harper & Row, $12.45.) Humor in
cartoons and verse.
LIFE EXTENSION, by Durk Pearson and Sandy Shaw. (Warner, $22.50.) Ways to
add years to your life and life to your years: a popularly written medical-science
book.
WHEN BAD THINGS HAPPEN TO GOOD PEOPLE, by Harold S. Kushner.
(Schocken, $10.95.) Comforting thoughts from a rabbi.
THE FALL OF FREDDIE THE LEAF, by Leo Buscaglia. (Holt/Slack, $7.95.) The
seasons of life as experienced by a leaf and its companions: a parable.
THE ONE MINUTE MANAGER, by Kenneth Blanchard and Spencer Johnson.
(Morrow, $15.) How to increase the productivity of those with whom you work as
well as your own.
HAVING IT ALL, by Helen Gurley Brown. (Simon & Schuster/Linden, $15.95.)
Advice for women about love, sex and money by the Cosmopolitan editor.
ATLANTIC HIGH, by William F. Buckley Jr. (Doubleday, $22.50.) Log of a trans-
Atlantic crossing aboard a luxurious ketch.
THE PATH TO POWER: The Years of Lyndon Johnson, by Robert A. Caro.
(Knopf, $19.95.) The first 33 years of the life of the 36th President.
MIRACLE AT MIDWAY, by Gordon W. Prange. (McGraw-Hill, $19.95.) The turning
point of the naval war in the Pacific in 1942.
